zone.line: excell the beautiful in beauty; & secondly
a familiarity with the best
many & excellent
especially
poets & with Homer the most godlike
among them
& admirable of poets, & your emulation
is [greater], to fa not merely to remember
the verses, but to fathom the deepest
meaning of this king of melody: for
rhap
it is the office of the [?rap] he is no
rhapsodist who does not understand
the whole purpose & scope & intention
of the poet, & is not capable of
interpreting it to his audience.-- This
he cannot do without a full compre
hension of the meaning of his author;
worthy indeed of envy are those who
[thus] can [attain it] S. fulfill these
conditions!-- You speak truly {o}
Socrates; and indeed I have expended
upon this my principal study upon this
circumstance of the art; I flatter myself
that no man living can excels me in
